t = int(input())
    for i in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        p = list(map(int, input().split()))
        p.sort()
        k = 2
        while k < n:
            if abs(p[k-1] - p[k]) <= abs(p[k-2] - p[k]):
                k += 1
            else: break

        print(k)
        print(*p[:k])
1:
t = int(input())
    for i in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        p = list(map(int, input().split()))
        p.sort()
        dp = [0] * n
        for i in range(1, n):
            dp[i] = max([dp[j] + abs(p[i]-p[j]) for j in range(i)])

        print(max(dp))

        ans = []
        for i in range(n-1, 0, -1):
            if dp[i] == max([dp[j] + abs(p[i]-p[j]) for j in range(i)]):
                ans.append(str(p[i]))
                dp[i-1] -= abs(p[i]-p[i-1])

        print(' '.join([str(_) for _ in reversed([int(_) for _ in ans])]))

if len(arr) == 1:
        return arr[0]
    else:
        max_num = 0
        for i in range(len(arr)):
            for j in range(i+1, len(arr)):
                if arr[i] == arr[j]:
                    new_arr = arr[:]
                    new_arr.pop(j)
                    new_arr.pop(i)
                    new_num = obtain_max_number(new_arr) * 2  # merge two equal numbers into one bigger number

                elif (arr[i] + arr[j]) % 2 == 0:  # check if the sum of two numbers is even and can be split into two equal numbers each.  If so, split them and add to the max number.  If not, skip this pair of numbers.

                    new_num = (int((arr[i] + arr[j]) / 2)) + obtain_max_number([x for x in arr if x != arr[i] and x != arr[j]])

                else:  # skip this pair of numbers because they cannot be merged or split into a larger number.

                    continue

                if new_num > max_num:  # update the max number with the largest value found so far.

                    max_num = new_num

        return max_num
